edu.biu.scapi.paddings
Class PKCS7Padding

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.paddings.PKCS7Padding
All Implemented Interfaces:
PaddingScheme
public final class PKCS7Padding
extends java.lang.Object
implements PaddingScheme

Concrete padding class implements the PKCS7 padding algorithm: the input shall be padded at the trailing end with k-(lth mod k) octets all having value k-(lth mod k), where lth is the length of the input. In other words, the input is padded at the trailing end with one of the following strings: 01 -- if lth mod k = k-1 02 02 -- if lth mod k = k-2 . . . k k ... k k -- if lth mod k = 0 This padding method is well defined if and only if k is less than 256.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Method Detail

pad

public byte[] pad(byte[] padInput,
                  int padSize)
Pads the given byte array with padSize bytes according to PKCS7 padding scheme.

The value of each added byte is the number of bytes that are added, i.e. N bytes, each of value N are added.

Specified by:
pad in interface PaddingScheme
Parameters:
padInput - array to pad
padSize - number of bytes to add to padInput array
Returns:
the padded array

removePad

public byte[] removePad(byte[] paddedInput)
Removes the padding from the given byte array according to PKCS7 padding scheme.

Specified by:
removePad in interface PaddingScheme
Parameters:
paddedInput - array to remove the padding from
Returns:
the array without the padding
